comment: One of the best professors I had the pleasure of taking a class with at KSU. He teaches great and its obvious he genuinely cares about his students. Grades in Dynamics came from HW,  2 midterms and a final. He is extremely reasonable with the difficultly and wants you to learn the concepts. An A is very doable here. Cant recommend enough.
The best instructor anyone can ever think of.
Loves to teach and loves thermodynamics, knows what he is talking about and is a very fair grader. Would take again.

Dr. Palle is a wonderful professor. He has a passion for what he teaches and it shows. He notices when you try and will provide you with the resources and knowledge to get an A in his class. I've taken him for 3 classes and haven't regretted a single one.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: On occasion you may forget youre in an engineering class and mistakenly walked into a life lessons or self enhancement class lol. BUt a great prof to take in todays world

Very kind and passionate professor. He wants you to succeed. 2 tests and a cumulative final. Tests can be difficult if you don't review the homework and read the chapters. Taking him again for Thermodynamics, and would definitely recommend.

He is very passionate about this course and goes above and beyond to help you understand the basics and skills. He is accessible outside of class for extra help. His tests are very similar to his lecture questions. His main goal is to teach the basics/fundamentals so his students can become better engineers and commons sense thinkers!
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Phenomenal professor, would take for many other classes if I could. Very concerned with your understanding of the subject matter, and very helpful in his office. Come with questions  and leave feeling like you have a better grasp.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: This class (ME1001) is a joke. Dr. Palle is a good guy & I respect him, but the class itself is a joke. Attendance is 30% of the grade. The questions are absurdly easy. There is no real material to learn. It's a freshman seminar course for engineering majors. If you actually want to learn about Mech Eng, do not take this course. Otherwise, OK prof.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Not much to this class besides the pumpkin launch group project that can be a hassle to do depending on your teammates. Besides that, just show up because attendance is 30% of your grade.

Lots of lectures, but the lectures aren't all related to mechanical engineering; most of them are related to study skills and goal-setting. If you take this class, take it in the fall; that's when the big project is the traditional pumpkin launch. Palle is a nice guy, but his lectures can get repetitive and boring. He talks a lot about car airbags.
